title: Codesource SEO critique
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020083745im_/http:/typophile.com/files/codesource5_5728.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020083745im_/http:/typophile.com/files/codesource4_3915.jpg)

any ideas? how about how to incorporate a spider without making it look evil.
author: P. Halley

comments.content: client wants like... ball bearing and a spider... ball bearing explaining the silver ball. he says the "O" gets lost. I'm having trouble thinking of ways to incorporate a spider that dont look like... haloweeny.

Yes. O gets lost. I read CODE SOURCE SE...  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
_Robert Koritnik_

Any time you need to ask, "How can I incorporate a spider into this design?" (never mind if it looks "evil" or not) then it's time to go back to the drawing board. Your concept is broken.

--  
Nick Hladek
